intro: Maxillaria consanguinea var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered maxillaria, is a tropical orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its elongated, pendulous inflorescences bearing numerous fragrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to orange with dark purple markings, and the leaves are broad and革质 (leathery). It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
